Rating: Not recommended for children under 16 years 


Synopsis: 
Kristen Stewart and Dakota Fanning star as Joan Jett and Cherie Currie, respectively, The Runaways, an initiation story moved by the music of pioneering female rock group of the decade of 1970, written and directed by Floria Sigismondi. 

Los Angeles, 1975, Joan Jett (KRISTEN STEWART) and Cherie Currie (DAKOTA FANNING), two teenagers from the San Fernando Valley with 'punk' in the veins, and become known in the body and soul of the influential The female group Runaways. Floria Sigismondi has Runaways to the big screen in this tale of a young group of extraordinary young people who become rebels in southern California rock stars of the legendary band that paved the way for future generations of women in the world music. Under the tight control and influence of rock entrepreneur Kim Fowley (Michael Shannon), the group becomes a resounding success and a family of misfits. With its tough-girl image and her raw talent, the group takes to acquire a certain reputation, like its two principal members: Joan heart is pure rock 'n' roll group, while Cherie, with her 'look "Bowie-style Bardot, is the sexy kitten. 

Notes: 
Biopic focused on the rock band 70's, 'The Runaways'. 

'The Runaways' was a punk rock group founded in the mid-seventies and was composed exclusively of teenage girls who had some glory years with hits such as' Queens of Noise', 'Neon Angels (On the Road to Ruin) 'Born to Be Bad' or 'Cherry Bomb'. The group disbanded in 1979 and some of its members tried to launch their solo careers, but without much success
